availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew McCampbell (Captain in the 20th Kentucky Infantry (Co. K) and Colonel of the 57th Regiment of Kentucky Militia)

body.p: Jessamine County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Mollie W. McCampbell. Farmer in Jessamine County in 1860. Captain in the 20th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) from January 6, 1862 to February 6,1863. Colonel of the 57th Regiment of Kentucky Militia in Jessamine County in October 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, Nicholasville, p. 115.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, District No. 2, p. 17.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0331.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 62-63.
KYR-0001-018-0198.
